results.deck: Legends and current superstars go at it in this over-the-top wrestling game from THQ's San Diego studio.
results.name: WWE All Stars

results.deck: Virtua Cop: Elite Edition is a compilation containing the first two Virtua Cop games for Playstation 2.
results.name: Virtua Cop: Elite Edition

results.deck: FIFA 11 is the yearly, best selling football (soccer) game by EA Sports. FIFA 11 features 11 v 11 online multiplayer and the ability to play as a goalkeeper.
results.name: FIFA 11

results.deck: Shepherd's Crossing is a strategy, simulation game that mixes elements of games from the Harvest Moon and Animal Crossing franchises. Trading and hunting also add to the mix!
results.name: Shepherd's Crossing

results.deck: Legend of the Dragon is a fighting game from The Game Factory for the Wii, PlayStation 2, and PSP based on the animated series of the same name. Characters can use Ki to transform into more powerful forms.
results.name: Legend of the Dragon

results.deck: Yet another game in the EyeToy series. This time it's aimed at girls who loves pompoms.
results.name: EyeToy Play: PomPom Party

results.deck: Another EyeToy mini game collection but this time it features the monkeys from Ape Escape.
results.name: EyeToy: Monkey Mania

results.deck: Yet another EyeToy minigame collection. This time it focuses on sports.
results.name: EyeToy Play Sports

results.deck: Strategy game set in feudal Japan, reimagined with anime girls.
results.name: Sengoku Hime 2: Senran no Yo, Gunyuu Arashi no Gotoku

results.deck: The first game in the Kenka Bancho series of Japanese brawlers.
results.name: Kenka Bancho

results.deck: The second Kenka Bancho game.  Like the first game it too has a cel-shaded style.
results.name: Kenka Bancho 2: Full Throttle

results.deck: A PlayStation 2 game based on the manga and anime YuYu Hakusho.
results.name: YuYu Hakusho Forever

results.deck: Yet another football game and this time it's endorsed by Sven-Göran.
results.name: Sven-Göran Eriksson's World Challenge

results.deck: A not so popular fighting game for Playstation 2.
results.name: Garouden Breakblow: Fist or Twist

results.deck: Golden Knight GARO is a hack & slash video game based on a Japanese tokusatsu drama. It is published by Bandai and was released in 2006 in Japan only.
results.name: Golden Knight GARO

results.deck: This creatively-titled go-kart racing simulation for the Nintendo Wii includes go-karts from the 60cc, 125cc and 250cc classes and 15 different courses from around the world. The game is a partner to the similarly-titled Truck Racer.
results.name: Kart Racer

results.deck: Based on the famous race around France, Tour de France is a cycling game for PS2 and Xbox from Konami.
results.name: Tour de France

results.deck: Released by Konami in order to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the Tour de France.
results.name: Tour de France: Centenary Edition

results.deck: A budget sidscrolling beat 'em up published by D3 Games (under the alias of Essential Games) and developed by Tamsoft
results.name: Dragon Sisters

results.deck: A budget action adventure title released for Playstation 2 and published by D3 (under the alias of Essential Games in Europe)
results.name: Buccaneer

results.deck: CROSS†CHANNEL is a Japanese visual novel about people who cannot fit into society.
results.name: CROSS†CHANNEL

results.deck: A bizarre, forgettable series of plot devices conspire to bring together the main characters of the most popular animated programs made by Nicktoons circa 2006.
results.name: Nicktoons: Battle for Volcano Island

results.deck: This page would cover everything about the SnoCross 2 game. It would cover new features and changes from the first game.
results.name: SnoCross 2: Featuring Blair Morgan

results.deck: This action game, based on the Macross franchise, allows players to relive both the 1982 anime series and the Do You Remember Love? movie.
results.name: The Super Dimension Fortress Macross

results.deck: Votoms is an action game based on the '80s anime series of the same name. The player assumes the role of Chirico Cuvie and fights using mecha known as "Armored Troopers."
results.name: Soukou Kihei Votoms

results.deck: Help Dora find her way home in time for her birthday party.
results.name: Dora's Big Birthday Adventure

results.deck: Jeremy McGrath is the mascot of this motorcross game where the player finds his/herself in a match pitting man and machine against sweet air. This game is a sequel to Motocross 2000.
results.name: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World

results.deck: An adventure game following the summer vacation of 9 year old Boku. It is the second game in the Boku no Natsuyasumi franchise.
results.name: Boku no Natsuyasumi 2: Umi no Dai Bouken

results.deck: Cabela's North American Adventures gives players the opportunity to experience hunting in more than 20 locations across the continent.
results.name: Cabela's North American Adventures

results.deck: Featuring full motion controls, players will be able to cast, reel, jig, set the hook and more as if they had an actual fishing rod in their hands.
results.name: Rapala Pro Bass Fishing

results.deck: Play as Mr Bean in his wacky adventure as he finds for his teddy bear, Teddy.
results.name: Mr Bean

results.deck: The SingStar series takes on some Bollywood hits.
results.name: SingStar Bollywood

results.deck: The real pool playing experience in the comfort of your own home. Play competitively against the computer or casually by yourself.
results.name: Real Pool

results.deck: A visual novel/dating sim based on the popular anime Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion.
results.name: Code Geass: Lost Colors

results.deck: Ultraman is a 2004 fighting game for the Sony PlayStation 2, based on the original Ultraman series.
results.name: Ultraman

results.deck: Ultraman Nexus is a Playstation 2 fighting game based on the japenese television series of the same name.
results.name: Ultraman Nexus

results.deck: Never Ending Tomorrow is an action game based on the Gundam SEED franchise.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Never Ending Tomorrow

results.deck: The Rumble Fish is a fighting game created by Dimps for the Atomiswave arcade platform. Its most distinguishing quality is its graphics engine, which animates the characters' limbs separately.
results.name: The Rumble Fish

results.deck: Rubu Tribe was an Action game, developed by Outrage Games and published by Interplay, which was cancelled before it was released.
results.name: Rubu Tribe

results.deck: An arcade racing game released on the PS2 and arcade by Taito in Japan. The game allowed you to carry your save file from the console version to the arcade version and the reverse.
results.name: Battle Gear 3

results.deck: Planned to coincide with Jurassic Park 3, Survival was to see players take on dinosaurs and terrorists alike as they fought to escape Isla Sorna. The game, however, quickly went extinct.
results.name: Jurassic Park: Survival

results.deck: A mountain biking game set in four different locations: The Rocky Mountains, The Alps, Hawaii, and The Grand Canyon.
results.name: Mountain Bike Adrenaline

results.deck: SingStar game featuring one of Sweden's biggest pop bands, Kent.
results.name: SingStar Kent

results.deck: The first game in the "Music" series by Jester Interactive released on the PS2. Music creation and remixing, featuring tracks by Gorillaz, Roni Size and others.
results.name: MTV: Music Generator 2

results.deck: PS2 racing game Driven to Destruction.
results.name: Driven to Destruction

results.deck: Motorcycle racing game
results.name: Harley-Davidson: Race to the Rally

results.deck: Kamen Rider Kabuto is released in Japan in Nov 30, 2006.
results.name: Kamen Rider Kabuto

results.deck: A Pachinko version of Kamen Rider.
results.name: Pachinko Kamen Rider

results.deck: A Singstar game created for Finnish audience.
results.name: Singstar SuomiHitit

results.deck: Cleopatra Fortune is an Egyptian-themed puzzle game.
results.name: Cleopatra Fortune

results.deck: A rally racing game based on the Race of Champions
results.name: Rally Fusion: Race of Champions

results.deck: Up to 4 players can compete in races and mini-games using the Buzz! controllers.
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Ace Racers

results.deck: Buzz! Junior: Dino Den is a PS2 game that uses the Buzz! controllers. Up to 4 players can compete in Dinosaur related mini-games.
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Dino Den

results.deck: Major League Baseball 2K11 is Visual Concepts iteration of the MLB franchise for the 2011 MLB season and features the Dynamic Player Rating system that updates player ratings on recent real-world performance.
results.name: Major League Baseball 2K11

results.deck: Shienryu is a vertical scrolling arcade shooter that was originally released in arcades and was later ported to the Sega Saturn. It was recently released on the North American Playstation store as a PSone Import Classic.
results.name: Shienryu

results.deck: Arcade flight shooter.
results.name: ExZeus

results.deck: A soccer game from Konami first released in 2001 on the Playstation 2. It was later ported to the GameCube and Xbox in 2002.
results.name: ESPN MLS ExtraTime

results.deck: A game based on the movie franchise of the same name. Only released in PAL territories despite being based on an American series with an American setting, due to such egregious errors as depicting Axel Foley, originally played by Eddie Murphy, as a white man.
results.name: Beverly Hills Cop

results.deck: An unfinished Atari 2600 game that was later released as part of various Atari game collections and Microsoft's Game Room.
results.name: Thwocker

results.deck: The sequel to Roommania #203
results.name: New Roommania: Porori Seishun

results.deck: Sony's MLB franchise returns for the 2011 baseball season, with PlayStation Move and 3D support.
results.name: MLB 11: The Show

results.deck: A hexagonal turn-based tactical RPG set in feudal Japan by Nihon Falcom that supports both single-player and multiplayer.
results.name: VM Japan: Vantage Master - Mystic Far East

results.deck: The sequal to Super Bust A Move and part of the long running Bust a Move frasnchise.
results.name: Super Bust-A-Move 2

results.deck: Third game in the MTV Music Generator series.
results.name: MTV Music Generator 3: This is the Remix

results.deck: A Lupin III puzzle game for PS2 and PSP, starring Inspector Zenigata.
results.name: Shuyaku wa Zenigata

results.deck: A Lupin III action-adventure game for PlayStation 2.
results.name: Lupin Sansei: Columbus no Isan

results.deck: A Lupin III action-adventure game for PS2. While game was released in Italy, it never saw a release in North America.
results.name: Lupin III: Lupin Is Dead, Zenigata Is In Love

results.deck: A Cardcaptor Sakura game for PlayStation 2 utilizing the Eye-Toy camera.
results.name: Cardcaptor Sakura: Sakura-Chan to Asobo!

results.deck: The most recent title in the role-playing series from Artdink, released for PlayStation 2.
results.name: Lunatic Dawn Tempest

results.deck: A kids game where you need buzzers. Has two releases, ps2 and psn
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Dino Den

results.deck: A Portuguese exclusive Singstar. It has some of the most famous Portuguese songs to date.
results.name: Singstar Portugal Hits

results.deck: A "wise talking, skirt chasing, skateboarding" hero is transported back in time to an Egypt-esque land and turned into wood. This game was never released.
results.name: D. Jump

results.deck: A mahjong game for PlayStation 2 and PSP.
results.name: Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai IV

results.deck: Dungeon crawler RPG developed by Starfish SD for PS2 in 2008, since ported to the Nintendo DS and PSP.
results.name: Elminage Original

results.deck: The series continues with Puchi Copter 2.
results.name: Puchi Copter 2

results.deck: EA's long-running NFL series returns with its 2011 release, Madden NFL 12. It features Cleveland Browns running back Peyton Hillis on the cover, who won as a result of fan voting.
results.name: Madden NFL 12

results.deck: Who Wants To Be a Millionaire: Party Edition is a PS2, PSP, and PC game released only in the UK.
results.name: Who Wants To Be a Millionaire: Party Edition

results.deck: 'Clean Sweeper' is a dating game for the PS2. The main focus of the game is keeping germs away from the girls you are dating.
results.name: Osouji Sentai Clean Sweeper H

results.deck: Real World Golf was released alongside the "Gametrak" peripheral in 2006 by Madcatz. It approximates real golf using straps attached to the player's wrists.
results.name: Real World Golf

results.deck: Tokyo Bus Guide 2 is a bus driving simulator and a sequel to Tokyo Bus Guide.
results.name: Tokyo Bus Guide 2

results.deck: A racing game released in 2003 featuring Mercedes-Benz automobiles.
results.name: World Racing

results.deck: The 2009 edition of Konami's longrunning Nippon Professional Baseball simulation.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 6

results.deck: The 2007 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation. This version marks the series' first appearance on the Playstation 3.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 4

results.deck: The 2005 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2

results.deck: The first entry in Konami's longrunning series of Nippon Professional Baseball league games.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2004

results.deck: This is an updated version of Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2004 released for the post season.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2004 Climax

results.deck: The 2008 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 5

results.deck: This is an updated version of Pro Yakyuu Spirits 5 released after the 2008 NPB season.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 5 Kanzenban

results.deck: Endgame is a light gun game for the PS2.
results.name: Endgame

results.deck: A racing game for the GameCube. All of the racing tracks are in suburbs and cities.
results.name: City Racer

results.deck: Music Maker is a music game for the PS2.
results.name: Music Maker

results.deck: Another entry in the longrunning Train Simulator series featuring the JR Rail Kyushu Shinkansen.
results.name: Train Simulator: Kyushu Shinkansen

results.deck: Another entry in the longrunning Train Simulator series featuring the Keisei, Toei Asakusa and Keikyu lines.
results.name: Train Simulator: Keisei, Toei Asakusa, and Keikyu Lines

results.deck: A collaboration between the Train Simulator and Densha de Go series, this game features the Toyoko line, the Den-en-toshi line, and the Oimachi line.
results.name: Train Simulator ＋ Densha de GO!: Tokyu Line

results.deck: Another entry in the longrunning Train Simulator series featuring the Midosuji Line.
results.name: Train Simulator: Midosuji Line

results.deck: Another entry in the longrunning Train Simulator series featuring the Yamanote Line.
results.name: Train Simulator Real: The Yamanote Line

results.deck: Another entry in the longrunning Train Simulator series featuring the Keihin Kyuko.
results.name: Train Simulator Real: The Keihin Kyuko

results.deck: The 2005 iteration of 989 Studio's MLB series.
results.name: MLB 2005

results.deck: The 2006 iteration of 989 Studio's MLB series.
results.name: MLB 2006

results.deck: An Oddworld game announced shortly after the release of Stranger's Wrath that was ultimately cancelled when Oddworld Inhabitants ceased internal production in 2005.
results.name: The Brutal Ballad of Fangus Klot
